title: spec: "innermost" for/switch must be limited to current function
body:
For break/continue statements the spec says:
====
If there is a label, it must be that of an enclosing "for",
"switch", or "select" statement, and that is the one whose execution
terminates.
====

However, Gc rejects to compile the following program:
http://play.golang.org/p/KGPK2K4ERe

The labeled for/switch looks like "enclosing", but I think the compiler is
right and the spec must more precisely define what is "enclosing".
